paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.phenotype: ATTR-PN with symptoms including burning pain, tingling paraesthesia, and cardiomyopathy

individual_records.phenotype_details: Progressive symptoms of neuropathy and cardiomyopathy.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Molecular genetic analysis showed the well-known amyloidogenic mutation, p.Ile127Val (Ile107Val), in exon 4 of the TTR gene, confirming diagnosis of ATTR-PN.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Asymptomatic carrier of the same amyloidogenic mutation.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Molecular genetic testing revealed the patient’s daughter to be an asymptomatic carrier of the same amyloidogenic mutation.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is known to be amyloidogenic and associated with ATTR-PN.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: The patient had a complex clinical presentation with features of both neuropathy and cardiomyopathy.
key_quotes: Molecular genetic analysis showed the well-known amyloidogenic mutation, p.Ile127Val (Ile107Val), in exon 4 of the TTR gene, confirming diagnosis of ATTR-PN.
Molecular genetic testing revealed the patient’s daughter to be an asymptomatic carrier of the same amyloidogenic mutation.

patients.phenotype: ATTR-PN with symptoms including burning pain, tingling dysesthesias, and severe gait disorder

individual_records.phenotype_details: Severe gait disorder, bladder dysfunction, and alternating episodes of constipation and diarrhea.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Molecular genetic analysis revealed a pathogenic mutation in exon 3 of the TTR gene, p.Glu81Lys (Glu61Lys), which was previously only reported in Japanese patients.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Tested positive for the same amyloidogenic mutation.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: One of the patient’s sons tested positive for the abovementioned amyloidogenic mutation.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is known to be amyloidogenic and associated with ATTR-PN.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: The patient had a complex clinical presentation with features of both neuropathy and cardiomyopathy.
key_quotes: Molecular genetic analysis revealed a pathogenic mutation in exon 3 of the TTR gene, p.Glu81Lys (Glu61Lys), which was previously only reported in Japanese patients.
One of the patient’s sons tested positive for the abovementioned amyloidogenic mutation.

functional_data.summary: The significance of the p.Gly26Ser variant in terms of amyloid formation remains to be determined.

variants.additional_notes: The variant was found in 10 cases but its clinical significance is uncertain.
key_quotes: In case of the p.Gly26Ser polymorphism, there were five patients with single nucleotide variants in non-coding regions of the TTR gene.

tables_processed.table_caption: TTR gene variants detected in 102 patients with polyneuropathy

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
